meanings.sent1: The loud music from the party was really exing my neighbors.
meanings.sent2: Stop poking me, you're exing me!
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten kept exing the dog's tail.
meanings.sent4: The constant buzzing of the mosquito was exing my ears.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet was exing her nerves to the breaking point.

meanings.definition: The act of causing annoyance or irritation.
meanings.sent1: Her constant complaining was an exing to everyone around her.
meanings.sent2: The never-ending construction noise was a constant exing for the residents.
meanings.sent3: The exing of the dripping faucet was finally fixed by the plumber.
meanings.sent4: The exing of the traffic jam made him late for the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The exing of the persistent telemarketer was finally blocked by the phone company.
